snippet: After a 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit near the same area affected by last year’s earthquake and tsunami, a television broadcaster urged people to “flee now to save your life!”
abstract: Earthquake registering 7.3 magnitude hits Japan in same area stricken by devastating 2011 earthquake and tsunami; broadcasters on public television throw aside their usual reserve to repeatedly issue warnings, with one host frantically urging people to flee to safety; no damage to nuclear plants is reported.

byline.contributor: Ken Belson and Shreeya Sinha contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: After a 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit near the same area affected by last year’s earthquake and tsunami, a television broadcaster urged people to “flee now to save your life!”

headline.seo: Japan Quake in Nuclear Plant Area Stirs Brief Alarm
headline.main: Japanese Quake Stirs On-Air Alarm, but No Damage to Nuclear Plants Is Reported
headline.print_headline: Japanese Quake Stirs On-Air Alarm, but No Damage to Nuclear Plants Is Reported
